page.title: 19FAMILY LIFE IN EDENBRIDGE
page.content: The average number of children per family is between two and three, with about a two year gap between them. Most fathers work and most mums have a part_time job. Children usually leave home at about twenty. Each family usually has a car though some have more, and it is accepted that each household will have such things as a television, radio, stereo, fridge, cooker and a washing machine. Such things as computers, video recorders and microwave ovens are not as commonplace. Much of the housing in the town is council_owned but the residents do have the option of purchasing their property. Most people prefer to do their weekly shop at the bigger towns of East Grinstead, Tunbridge Wells or Oxted as facilities are better....by Sally Le'Avy.
